data.title: Who Are the NBA’s - Image 1 from Who Are the NBA’s Next Players Turned Coaches?
data.meta_description: Who Are the NBA’s Next Players Turned Coaches? - There seems to be a growing trend among NBA teams searching for a head coach — grab veterans, specifically veteran point guards, immediately after their careers end. The fact that they have no prior coaching experience seems to be OK. The Brooklyn Nets employed that strategy last June, naming Jason Kidd their head coach less than a month after the future Hall of Fame guard called it quits. On Tuesday, the New York Knicks formally named Oklahoma City’s veteran point guard Derek Fisher their new head coach just 10 days after the Thunder's season ended. Kidd fared well in his rookie year as a head coach, leading the Nets to a 44-38 record and into the Eastern Conference semifinals. How will Fisher, a five-time NBA champion, do in his first year as a coach? Here, keeping with the trend, BET.com points out eight veteran guards as po... - These ballers might be calling the shots from the sidelines.
